It took me years before I finally played Half-Life, which is considered one of the greatest games of all time. I was skeptical of its quality before I played it. I finally got it during the Steam Summer Sale 2017 in the Valve Classic Collection. I first booted up Half-Life: Source. I got to Blast Pit before switching to GoldSrc Half-Life upon hearing of a glitch involving rockets and Apache Helicopters that was present in HL:S. The opening sequence on the tram was cool, but I'd still want an option to skip it. I appreciate the slower buildup to action thats present, a contrast to other 90's shooters like DOOM and Quake, both games that I love and play frequently. The gunplay was solid and fun. I really liked the amount of diversity in enemy types that kept fights from getting stale. However, the human enemies were not so fun. The soldiers had perfect aim, high HP, and the actual AI was uber annoying. Thankfully the human enemies are only present in about 50-60% of the game. Your weaponry is a nice blend between returning FPS classics like the shotgun, SMG/Assault Rifle, and pistol, and unique weapons, like the Tau Cannon, Gluon Gun, and the Hivehand. Even the .357 Python is a nice little addition. The level design was very high qualiy in parts of the game, but did suffer in other parts. I give Half-Life a pass in some of its confusing level design because it was made in the 90's. As long as I don't have to use a walkthrough online, the level design isn't too obtuse. I never had to use a walkthrough while playing Half-Life. 

Despite all this, despite all my praise and two negative comments, I agree that Half-Life is overrated. I HIGHLY recommend playing this game, but do not go in expecting one of the greatest experiences of your entire gaming career. But perhaps that's just me. Keep your mind open if you buy this game. Don't expect disappointment, like I did, but don't expect a Video Game From The Gods. Instead, expect a high quality First Person Shooter with an immersive setting, no cutscenes, good gunplay and occasionally confusing level design. Also, don't expect a great story or great storytelling. The story is OK, but the storytelling is worse. There really are no characters in the game. Half-Life 2 fixes that and adds actual characters, but I'm talking about Half Life 1. I give Half-Life an 8.5/10. I recommend that anyone who likes First Person Shooters buy this game.

EDIT: I can't believe I left this out, but the last four levels, (The Xen levels) are complete garbage. Everything up to this point is great. Thankfully three of the four Xen levels are short.

If you play games, you need to play this to understand the history of gaming. Oh and, its also super fun to play. The gameplay variety is something you don't see in many games today. Granted its a very linear game, you have a lot of choice on how to play within those boundaries. You'll see what I'm talking about when you play it. Its just a classic. 

The main problems you will encounter are:

1) Janky hyperspeed movement - this just comes with the territory of old PC games. nothing new to see here

2) Randomly getting physically stuck on walls or corners, etc - weird game glitch. didn't really ruin the exp unless you aren't quick saving a lot (hint: quick save a lot)

Que puedo decir de este juego? Una joya que revoluciono la industria de los videojuegos de la mano de Valve, mi saga favorita de videojuegos, aunque los graficos no sean lo mejor, la historia y la jugabilidad son increibles, protagonizando al cientifico Gordon Freeman que trabaja en las instalaciones de Black Mesa, un laboratorio escondido en una base militar de "Nuevo Mexico", para que un dia ocurran "Consecuencias Imprevistas". Sus extensiones como lo es Blue Shift y Opposited Forces son increibles tambien. Su gran misterio G-man con el que Valve nos dejo intrigados es una maravilla, como lo hicieron tan bien?
The graphics haven't aged well, sure. But the game still does a great job of creating an atmosphere and immersing you through its unique story telling. Well worth it if you haven't played it yet.

It's a classic for a reason. This is a game that would go onto spawn additional campagin's like half life blue shift and opposing force. It also helped to give birth to the ever popular Counter Strike that started out as a mod for this very game. The gameplay is still rock solid and holds up even after all these years. While the graphics do look a bit dated by today's standards it is still a very well rounded game and supports HD textures and such which do help improve the look of the game. If you have yet to play it then than it is definatly worth getting as it is a true gem from its time.

One of the greatest shooters ever.

Pros:
-Looks great for its time. Some 3D models have been upgraded to a more detailed design.
-Sounds are incredible even by today's standards
-Everything runs and feels ultra smooth and responsive
-Awesome level design where interesting and unexpected things keep happening
-Interesting and varied enemy and weapons selection
-Great level of detail: shootouts create a glorious mess of the environment. Many objects are destructible. There's red and green blood all over the place, and enemies also often blow up into little pieces of meat that fly all over the place. Overall, the immersion is extremely solid, even if the game does not have "proper" rigid body physics model.
-CHALLENGING!! Much more so than most newer shooters, including Half-Life 2
-Awesome soundtrack that kicks in during nice moments
-No hardware problems while running the game on a modern system
-While the game has an FPS cap, it is set at 100, which is great considering some new games get released with an FPS cap of 60 or even 30
-Fun multiplayer deathmatch, games with live players can still be found!

Cons:
-On Hard difficulty level some enemies can feel slightly bullet-spongy. Human enemies can take an unrealistic amount of punishment from some weapons, as can the player himself. This seems to be a design choice, but I feel having a larger number of weaker enemies, or making the player weaker, would have been a better choice to increase difficulty.
-Graphically outdated by 2017 standards
-No rigid body physics modeling, as the technology didn't exist at the time of release
-Hand grenade physics could be described as funky
-No bullet holes on enemies :(
It's a good game, even after 20 years.

What can be said about this game that's not been already said? 

One of the most beloved silent heroes of videogames, stars the first quest to try to solve the hell that a very inquisitive science unleashed in our world. Featuring a conflict involving weird aliens and savage military men, an adventure filled with relentless enemies, dangerous enviroments and, well, somewhat annoying physics. 

The game is an old school first person shooter, that means lots of cool weapons, lots of explosions and lots of killing. The mulitplayer component it's quite good, however, since i live in South America i have quite a hard time finding a server with a low ping.

All in all, if you like classic games, go get this one. If you don't, go get it as well and see what's the deal with all this Half-Life (and it's sequels) fuss nearly two decades before it's release.

An absolute classic and one of the stepping stones on the gaming industry. It's actually rather sad to see how little progress we've made since this game in the FPS genre. Despite the outdated graphics and while today it's innovations are taken for granted, it is still one of the best games ever made and one that everyone should have. A testament of what most games only aspire to be. An experience.

This game has a good storyline, but repetitive gameplay. Sometimes, you can get confused on what to do however, because the game doesn't make it clear on what you need to do next. 

I would recommend to buy it only for the storyline. However, if you want to save money then just watch playthroughs of it on Youtube.
